name: Turtle Beach by Elegant Hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was worried upon reading the mixed reviews for this hotel. As soon as we arrived my worries were dismissed. We were greeted with cold towels, rum punch and friendly attentive staff.
reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday And Wedding

likes.disliked: — Bathroom Could Do With A Little Attention

reviews.text: We got married at Turtle Beach and it couldn't have been better. The weding planner dealt with everything and there was no stress at all to interrupt the holiday.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: The pools are lovely and well maintained. The beach and watersports team were fantasic, we really enjoyed the hobey cat trips.
reviews.title: 7 th Stay at this hotel
loved it yet again
reviews.text: Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff there and the food was lovely. Our wine glasses were constantly refilled, resulting in some hangovers!
All in all I would definitely recommend Turtle Beach and we are saving already in the hope of returning
reviews.title: Dont believe all you read!!

likes.liked: — Great setting, near entertainment and nightlife
likes.disliked: — Not being able to snorkel on the beach

reviews.text: Where do I begin? Turtle Beach resort is amazing. You really are in paradise. We were up-graded due to getting married and when I stood on the balcony & saw the view I cried! It was breath taking. The room was fantastic and the maids did a fantastic job of cleaning it to such a high standard. The staff were amazing. They went out of their way to accomodate us and we couldn't have asked for a warmer welcome. Our wedding day was incredible. Roselyn is truly amazing and will move heaven and earth to make your wedding day just right. The lady rushes about all day trying to make your day perfect. I couldn't fault her in anyway. Maradona and Tyson are brilliant lads. They go out of their way to talk to you and bring you drinks - wherever you are! The lads at the watersports hut on the beach are brilliant fun. They will set up whatever games you want. Terrance on reception is a true gent and will help you with any query. A must is Bajan Roots & Rhythm. What an amazing night. The atlantis submarine trip is fantastic. Scuba diving with Dive Pro is a must. The food at the resort is gorgeous, the place is immaculate and always maintained, the beach is stunning, cleaned every morning and the breeze is good! The sea is choppy to say the least but warm and remarkable to see.
reviews.title: Stunning!

reviews.text: I have read some of the reports and if you are worried about a little scratch on a piece of furniture or a stunning bird coming so close to have a little something to eat then you best cancel your holiday quick! Oh, and if you do, please contact me cos we are more than happy to take your place!
reviews.title: Hotel not as good as expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To sum Barbados up??? It's like a postcard. This really is paradise!
reviews.title: Great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel during June 2007. We read all reviews on tripadvisor prior to going to Barbados and went with an open mind.
reviews.title: Nice resort on a beautiful island

reviews.text: We were however disappointed with the hotel. It was advertised as 4.5 ticks in the Virgin brochure and for the price we paid we expected it to be a little more luxurious than it was. We did not expect it to be a palace but we would not rate the hotel at more than 3.5 star.
reviews.title: needs updating badly

reviews.text: one of the best holidays of my life!i went with my family (mum,dad, 3 daughters aged 18,21,23) in february 06. the hotel was lovely, clean, nice food, safe, great pool, and great location!the sea was so much fun, quite rough because its further down the coast, which made for great body boarding inbetween sunbathing, lots of fun! the tide comes in really high aswell;at the end of the day your sunlouger is in the sea slightly,which is actually really relaxing having the tide come in around u! the hotel also has jet skis and catamarans to use which are also lots of fun, the guys that ran the watersports were really nice and helpul.we walked up the beach a few times where the sea is calmer and the snorkelling is great! you get people on the beach selling jewellery and shells and things which is nice, and you also get stoned rastas trying to sell you drugs in particular 'cokaena' coming up to u a few times a day, and altho that mite sound really bad, it was in no way threatening or unnerving,and they only bother u if ur young looking,and if u say no thanks they dont botha u at all, it was actually quite amusing, we got talking to one and sed why dont u get a job, and he sed if he can make money selling drugs whilst relaxing on the beach why bother!there is a guard who stops them coming off the beach into the pool area
reviews.title: amazing hotel in an amazing place

reviews.text: i was dubious about staying in an all inclusive hotel, because usually me and my family stay at 4/5* hotels and eat in the a la carte restaurant or out in nice restaurants, but the food was good, and it was nice having fresh fruit and cocktails brought round to you whilst sunbathing on the beach!as well as cold wet towels to cool u down.at night the entertainment was ok to good, but probably one of the best things that made my holiday was that everyone was very sociable, every night we stayed in the bar drinking the all inclusive drinks(no bar tab at the end of the holiday to surprise dad which was good) and getting merry!
reviews.title: Great Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: a great holiday , if you've got teenagers id definitely reccomend turtle beach and barbados in general, great friendly hotel, loads to do like watersports,snorkelling,good clothes and jewelley shopping, the oistens fish night is well worth going to, as is a trip to the east coast.
reviews.title: Honeymoon at Turtle Beach

reviews.text: We have just returned from two weeks at the Turtle and it was great.
reviews.title: No bang for your buck!

reviews.text: We had an Ocean View one bed suite which was spacious, clean and the mini bar was well stocked. As we were a family of four it suited us to have all the space.
reviews.title: Great Holiday

reviews.text: We have just come back from 2 weeks and had a great time.
reviews.title: Had A Great Time
Great Island...Shame about the Hotel!
reviews.text: Our room was lovely and yes some could do with an update but you are not in your room all day. Maradona and Tyson are fantastic at getting your drinks all day and yes the birds do try to get your food but you get used to it.
Our daughter had a good time in the kids club and also in the sea. The sea not good for young ones but for older ones it is ok.
reviews.title: read this first

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want calm seas go the sister hotel Crystal Cove which we did for the day.
reviews.title: Turtle Beach indeed

reviews.text: If you want to get out you can walk to the Gap about 10mins and their are some nice resturants there. Also if you get the chance go out to The Cliff for dinner it is well worth it.
reviews.title: Loved it!

aka: Turtle Beach By Elegant Hotel Dover
description: "A vibrant blend of contemporary style and informal elegance." A truly magnificent all-inclusive property of 166 rooms situated on a glorious stretch of the south coast of Barbados. Turtle Beach Resort uniquely combines contemporary style, informal elegance, lively atmosphere and a superb range of facilities suitable for all ages, including a supervised Tommy Turtle Kids Club (for children aged 3-11) setting new standards for all-inclusive holidays to the Caribbean.
